dcterms:creator: Larry Stockmeyer
dcterms:description: The best-known deterministic approximate counting algorithm that uses polynomially many calls to a ΣP2 oracle with the query constructed over n2 log2 n variables.
dcterms:title: Stockmeyer's algorithm

dcterms:creator: Mate Soos
Stephan Gocht
Kuldeep S. Meel
dcterms:description: Approximate model counting algorithms that have matured to the point where they can count solutions of propositional constraints with several thousands of variables within a couple of hours on a standard laptop.
dcterms:title: Approximate model counting algorithms

dcterms:creator: Armin Biere
Marijn Heule
Hans van Maaren
Toby Walsh
dcterms:description: SAT/QBF solvers that serve as proxies for oracles in approximate counting algorithms.
dcterms:title: SAT/QBF solvers

dcterms:creator: Mihir Bellare
John Rompel
dcterms:description: A method for randomness-efficient oblivious sampling that is relevant for approximate counting algorithms.
dcterms:title: Randomness-efficient oblivious sampling

dcterms:creator: Ross M. McConnell
Kurt Mehlhorn
Stefan Näher
Pascal Schweitzer
dcterms:description: Algorithms that provide certifiable results for approximate counting, ensuring correctness of results.
dcterms:title: Certifying algorithms

dcterms:creator: Kevin K. H. Cheung
Babak Moazzez
dcterms:description: Certificates of optimality for mixed integer linear programming that can be used in approximate counting.
dcterms:title: Certiﬁcates of optimality for mixed integer linear programming

dcterms:creator: Stephan Gocht
Ruben Martins
Jakob Nordström
Andy Oertel
dcterms:description: Certified CNF translations for pseudo-Boolean solving that can be utilized in approximate counting.
dcterms:title: Certiﬁed CNF Translations for Pseudo-Boolean Solving

dcterms:creator: Gabrielle Beck
Maximilian Zinkus
Matthew Green
dcterms:description: A method for automating the development of chosen ciphertext attacks that can be relevant in the context of approximate counting.
dcterms:title: Automating the development of chosen ciphertext attacks

dcterms:creator: George C. Necula
Peter Lee
dcterms:description: A certifying compiler that ensures the correctness of results produced by algorithms, relevant for approximate counting.
dcterms:title: Certifying Compiler

dcterms:creator: Michael Sipser
dcterms:description: A complexity theoretic approach to randomness that can be applied in the context of approximate counting.
dcterms:title: A complexity theoretic approach to randomness
